Feature.Name: Ignite (Simple Property)
Feature.Text: As an action, you scribe the ild rune using ash onto a flammable object. That object immediately bursts into flame. While it burns, the fire extends 1 foot out from the rune you scribed.

Feature.Name: Fire Tamer (Simple Property)
Feature.Text: As an action, you touch an open flame and scribe the ild rune within it with a hand motion. This causes the flame to immediately extinguish. For a large blaze, the fire is extinguished in a 10-foot radius around you. You can extend this distance by expending a spell slot when using the ild rune in this manner. The radius extends by 20 feet per level of the expended spell slot.

Feature.Name: Fire’s Friend (Simple Property)
Feature.Text: While you are attuned to this rune, you have resistance to cold damage.

Feature.Name: Combustion (Complex Property)
Feature.Text: As an action, you scribe this rune using ash onto a creature within your reach as you expend a spell slot. The creature automatically takes 1d10 fire damage plus 1d10 fire damage per level of the expended spell slot.

Feature.Name: Flame Brand (Complex Property)
Feature.Text: Over the course of a short rest, you inscribe this rune using ash onto a melee or ranged weapon, or onto up to 20 pieces of ammunition. The weapon or ammunition gains a ghostly aura of yellow flame and deals fire damage instead of piercing, slashing, or bludgeoning damage. In addition, you can expend a spell slot while using this property to grant the weapon or ammunition a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls equal to the spell slot’s level divided by three. These effects last for 24 hours or until you use this property again.

Feature.Name: Flame Stoker (Complex Property)
Feature.Text: While you are attuned to this rune, your fire attacks are deadlier. Whenever you roll fire damage from an attack or a spell you cast, you can reroll that damage and use the higher result.

MagicProperty.Name: Opal of the Ild Rune
MagicProperty.Description: This triangular fire opal measures about three inches on each side and is half an inch thick. The ild rune—the rune of fire—shimmers within its core. Grasping this object causes a split second of searing, fiery pain to pass through you. That pain quickly fades, giving way to a warming glow.
MagicProperty.Source: Unearthed Arcana 9 - Prestige Classes and Rune Magic
